form.label: SplunkVersionControl Restore
form.description: Use this page to request the restoration of a Splunk knowledge object, note that once restored the previous knowledge object is overwritten so use this restoration page with caution. Note the "Restore As User?" is for Splunk Admin use only

search.query: | rest /services/apps/local search="disabled=0" count=0 f=title splunk_server=local | rename title as app | search NOT [ | inputlookup splunkversioncontrol_globalexclusionlist ] | table app

div.div:
Description
This dashboard allows an individual to request the restoration of a Splunk knowledge object that has previously been backed up to a git repository
Usage
Application NameSplunk Application Name where the object is located
Object TypeThe Splunk knowledge object type, such as dashboard, savedsearch et cetera
Object URI/NameThe dashboard URI (in this current case splunkversioncontrol_restore) or the name of the savedsearch et cetera, note this field is case sensitive
Restore date/timeThe date/time of the git tag that should be used to restore the object, choose the closest date/time to which you know the object either existed or was in a working state
Restore as user?This field is for Splunk admin use only. If you are restoring an object and it needs to be owned by another user, use this field to enter the username (useful for when the object owner no longer exists in Splunk)
Scope/SharingDid the object have application level/global sharing or user level (private) sharing? If All is selected the restoration will run against both user level and app/global level.
Note that you can have an object, such as a dashboard with the same name at the user/private sharing level and the app sharing level within the same Splunk application which is why this field exists

panel.title: This output displays what has been added to the restoration request list after the submit button is clicked

search.query: | savedsearch "SplunkVersionControl AddToLookup" app="$app$", type="$type$", name="$name$", tag="$tag$", user="$env:user$", restoreAsUser="$restoreAsUser$", scope="$scope$"
